sen.j: 心を寛大にして相手やその間違いを即座に否定せず反発せず受け入れ、穏やかに説得することをいう。
sen.e: Shoju means tolerant approach to a person without denying the person or the person's misunderstanding at the beginning, and calmly waken the person out of the misunderstanding by means of moral suasion.

sen.j: 「勝鬘経（しょうまんきょう）」や「大日経（だいにちきょう）」を出典とする。
sen.e: The sources of the word is Shoman-gyo and Dainichi-kyo.

sen.cmt: 「勝鬘経」の英訳、[http://www.buddhistdoor.com/OldWeb/bdoor/archive/nutshell/teach50.htm]「大日経」の英訳[http://tangorin.com/words/sutra]を補足しました。

sen.j: 「勝鬘経（しょうまんぎょう）」では「我得力時。於彼処見此衆生。応折伏者而折伏之。応摂受者而摂受之。何以故。以折伏摂受故令法久住」と説き、折伏が相手の間違いを厳しく責めて「破折屈伏（はしゃくくっぷく）」させることに対し、摂受は相手の間違いをいったん容認して、穏やかに説得しその間違いを正していくことをいう。
sen.e: Shoman-gyo goes '我得力時。於彼処見此衆生。応折伏者而折伏之。応摂受者而摂受之。何以故。以折伏摂受故令法久住.' That means while shakubuku is to "hasha-kuppuku" a person (crush and force a person to submit) by torturing the person fot the person's misunderstanding, shoju is to accept person's misunderstanding once and to calmly correct the person by wakening the person out of the misunderstanding.

sen.e: Shoman-gyo goes '我得力時。於彼処見此衆生。応折伏者而折伏之。応摂受者而摂受之。何以故。以折伏摂受故令法久住.' That means while shakubuku is to "hasha-kuppuku" a person (crush and force a person to submit) by torturing the person because of the person's misunderstanding, shoju is to accept person's misunderstanding once and to calmly correct the person by wakening the person out of the misunderstanding.

According to 'Shoman-gyo', it is stated as follows: While shakubuku is to crush and force a person to submit his own misunderstanding by torture, shoju is to accept one's misunderstanding and then calmly correct it.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。また漢文については、次に説明があるので省きました。

sen.j: 悪人を折伏し善人を摂受することで、この二門は仏道の大綱であるとされる。
sen.e: It is considered that the fundamental principle of Buddhism consists of the two ways; performing shakubuku on the evil and performing shoju on the good.
It is considered that the fundamental principle of Buddhism consists of two ways; performing shakubuku on the evil and performing shoju on the good.

sen.j: また折伏を智慧門、摂受を慈悲門に配す解釈もある。
sen.e: According to an interpretation, shakubuku is categorized as the Chie mon (entry of wisdom) and shoju is categorized as the Jihi mon (entry of compassion).

According to other interpretation, shakubuku is categorized as the Chie mon (entry of wisdom) and shoju is categorized as the Jihi mon (entry of compassion).

sen.j: 吉蔵は、「勝鬘宝窟（しょうまんほうくつ）」で、「強情は伏すべし。伏して悪を離れしむべし。柔軟（にゅうなん）は摂すべし。摂して善に住せしむ。故に摂受・折伏と名づくなり」と注釈した。
sen.e: Kichizo annotated in his Shoman hokutsu, "obstinacy should be crushed,

Kichizo annotated in his 'Shoman hokutsu' (interpretation of Shoman-gyo Sutra), 'obstinacy should be crushed, crushed to separate a person from the evil spirit, pliability should be adopted, adopted to lead a person to the home of goodness. These are examples of how shoju and shakubuku were named.'
sen.cmt: 括弧内に「。」が含まれ文が分割していたため、1セルにまとめました。またイタリックを正体に戻し、英訳を補足しました。

sen.j: 日蓮は、当時の日本国を謗法（ぼうほう、誹謗正法＝ひぼうしょうぼうの略語で正しい法をそしること）と定めた。
sen.e: Nichiren judged Japan of his days to be Hobo (abbreviation of Hiboshoho (Slander of the True Dharma), meaning to slander the true teaching).

sen.j: 開目抄で「無智悪人の国土に充満の時は摂受を前（さき）とす、安楽行品（あんらくぎょうぼん）の如し。邪智謗法の者多き時は折伏を前とす、常不軽品（じょうふきょうぼん）の如し」と定めた。
sen.e: In his Kaimoku-sho, he decided "When the bad and the ignorant fill the land, put shoju first, like Anrakugyohon. When the wrong and the malicious are so many, put shakubuku first, like Jofukyobon."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

In his Kaimoku-sho (On the opening of the eyes, one of Nichiren's most important doctrinal treatises), he decided 'When the bad and the ignorant fill the land, put shoju first, like Anrakugyohon (Peaceful Practices, the fourteenth chapter of the Lotus Sutra). When the wrong and the malicious are so many, put shakubuku first, like Jofukyobon' ((Bodhisattva) Never Disparaging, the twentieth chapter of the Lotus Sutra).
sen.cmt: 「開目抄」の英訳[http://nippon-kichi.jp/article_list.do;jsessionid=A0072B9166E01860B4B3118ECC47418B?p=5587&ml_lang=en]および「安楽行品」の英訳[http://www.sgilibrary.org/search_dict.php?id=1676]を補足しました。「常不軽品」の英訳を補足しました。[http://www.sgilibrary.org/search_dict.php]

sen.j: 日蓮が、法華経の常不軽品をもって折伏の例を出したのは、天台宗の智顗の「法華文句（ほっけもんく）」によったものである。
sen.e: Nichiren exemplified shakubuku by Jofukyobon in Hokekyo (Lotus Sutra) because he referenced Hokke Monku (Words and Phrases of the Lotus Sutra) written by Chigi (or Zhiyi) in the Tendai sect.

Nichiren exemplified shakubuku by Jofukyobon in Hokekyo (Lotus Sutra) because he referenced Hokke Monku (Words and Phrases of the Lotus Sutra) written by Chigi (or Zhiyi) in the Tendai sect.

sen.j: そこに登場する常不軽菩薩が人々から誹謗中傷されても、常不軽菩薩自身は人々を軽んぜず、一心に礼拝したことである。
sen.e: Nichiren used Jofukyobon as an example because Jofukyobosatsu which appeared in Hokke Monku prayed for people with his whole heart without disdaining them even if he was slandered by them.

sen.j: 今日の一般的な認識においても、また一部の法華系教団においても折伏がいわゆる人々への強引な布教活動だと誤解される向きがある。
sen.e: Misunderstandingly, it is commonly recognized in Japan, and taken for granted in some religious bodies of the Hokke Sect line that shakubuku is forcible missionary work for people.

sen.j: しかしながら、日蓮自身はそのような強引な布教行為ではない。
sen.e: Nichiren did not mean such a forcible missionary work by the word shakubuku.

sen.j: 常不軽菩薩のように人々から誹謗中傷されて迫害を受けても、ひたすら正しい真理（正法）を求め、また理路整然と伝えていくことが真の折伏である、ということを表している。
sen.e: He said that the real shakubuku was to devote oneself to seeking of the truth (the true teachings of Buddha) and logically teaching of the truth to the people even if one is slandered and persecuted by them like Jofukyobosatsu.

sen.j: また日蓮は「唱法華題目鈔」などに、慈悲の「慈」を父の愛として、それが折伏であり、「悲」を母の愛として、それを摂受であるとした。
sen.e: In Sho-hokke-daimoku-sho (On Chanting the Daimoku of the Lotus Sutra) and the like, Nichiren described that the letter 慈 in 慈悲 (compassion) means the fatherly love which is shakubuku, and the letter 悲 means maternal love which is shoju.

sen.j: そのことから、摂受の裏に折伏があり、反対に折伏の裏に摂受があることを示唆した。
sen.e: With those descriptions, he implied that shoju backs up shakubuku, and shakubuku backs up shoju.

sen.j: 従って、日蓮がいみじくも指摘したように、摂受も折伏も異なるように見えるが、仏の正しい法へと導くための大事な手だてであり、どちらも離れて存在し得ない化導法である。
sen.e: Therefore, as it was quite appropriately described by Nichiren, both shoju and shakubuku are important means for leading people to the true teaching of Buddhism, although they appeared different.

sen.j: つまり仏法においては不二即一の法門から、摂受即折伏、折伏即摂受ということができる。
sen.e: According to homon (the teachings of Buddhism) of Fujisokuitsu in the Buddhist law, it can be said that shoju is nothing but shakubuku, and shakubuku is nothing but shoju.
